forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 8 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds with a whisper of sunlight breaking through the clouds, though the air carries a slight chill as the temperatures dip toward the mid-fifties. A westward wind dances through the streets, urging the clouds along, yet their playful shadows offer a slight chance of rain before the hour turns to four. The buzz of the city pulses beneath the brooding sky, and though the chance of precipitation lingers at 20%, one senses the tide of clarity gradually gliding in. Tonight, expect a cool embrace as the skies clear, settling into a low around 46, easing into a calm evening under a quilt of stars. 

For those navigating this afternoon's mild embrace, a light jacket or sweater would serve well against the brisk breeze, perfect for a stroll along the waterfront or a visit to one of the city’s tranquil parks. Perhaps a stop by a quaint café, where the warmth inside invites a moment of repose, sipping a comforting beverage while watching the city pulse outside, feels just right. Embrace the simplicity of the day, for even the most ordinary of activities can harbor an element of delight against the ever-changing backdrop of San Francisco’s skyline.
